text:
="preserve">Madhavrao Laxmanrao Apte (5 October 1932 – 23 September 2019) was a former Indian cricketer. He played in 7 Tests from 1952 to 1953. He was elected to the office of the President of the Cricket Club of India in 1989. Apte was born in Bombay.
Apte died on 23 September 2019 at a Mumbai hospital from cardiac arrest at the age of 86.
